intro: Cochlearia wunderlichii, commonly known as the Wunderlich's cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in late summer. It thrives in rocky, coastal or alpine environments and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Cochlearia wunderlichii is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is a rare species with limited geographic distribution.
